result.execSummary:
The defendant Tori O Sindic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 10 days sentence, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to Washington County or any other County.
Concurrent with: Count 2.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Court costs and DNA surcharge.  PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Boston Store at Brookfield Square.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Case 15CM2227 was dismissed as read in.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tori O Sindic in court with attorney Andrew J Shaw.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of counts 1 & 2.
Repeater enhancers struck on both counts.
Count 3 is dismissed as a read in.


Court orders the following:
Count 1:
250 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to:  Count 2.
10 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Concurrent to: count 2.
Court will allow for transfer to Washington County or anyother County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Contact with:  Boston Store at Brookfield Square.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).


Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.




Count 2:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to:  Count 1.
10 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Concurrent to:  count 1.
Court will allow for transfer to Washington County or anyother County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $243
Apply Bail and Balance to be refunded to the posting party
